meanings.definition: A person who campaigns vigorously for political, social, or religious change.
meanings.sent1: The young crusader spoke passionately about the need for equality in society.
meanings.sent2: The environmental crusader organized a protest to save the local park.
meanings.sent3: The crusader for animal rights wore a cape made of recycled materials.
meanings.sent4: She was a crusader for justice, fighting against corruption in the government.
meanings.sent5: The determined crusader never gave up on her mission to end poverty.

meanings.definition: A participant in any of the military expeditions undertaken by Christian powers in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries to recover the Holy Land from the Muslims.
meanings.sent1: The brave crusader donned his armor before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: Many knights joined the crusaders on their quest to reclaim Jerusalem.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy crusader tripped over his own sword during training.
meanings.sent4: In the epic tale, the crusader fought valiantly against the enemy forces.
meanings.sent5: The determined crusader rode into the sunset, ready to face any challenge ahead.
